headline.main: John M. Gravitt, 61, a Pioneer In Lawsuits by Whistle-Blowers

lead_paragraph: John M. Gravitt, a former foreman for GE Aircraft Engines who made it easier for whistle-blowers and the federal government to win damages in fraud cases involving government contracts, died on Friday. Mr. Gravitt, who lived in Cincinnati, was 61. The cause was complications from diabetes, according to his wife, Marlene.
abstract: John M Gravitt, former foreman for GE Aircraft Engines who made it easier for whistle-blowers and federal government to win damages in fraud cases involving government contracts, dies at age 61 (M)
